definition: to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)

sentences.english: I guarantee that you'll like this book.
sentences.chinese: 我管保這件事情能辦好。

sentences.english: I guarantee that if you take this medicine, you'll soon get well.
sentences.chinese: 我管保你吃了這藥就好。

sentences.english: He'll come up to the scratch in a way that will surprise you when your case is heard.
sentences.chinese: 你的案子一開審，他會全力以赴，管保叫你喫驚。

sentences.english: Since that is the case, I am sure I shall not tease you any further.
sentences.chinese: 既然情況如此，我管保不再嘲弄你了。

sentences.english: Now, my dear, I bring you something that I am sure will do you good.
sentences.chinese: 喂，親愛的，我給你帶來一樣東西，管保叫你高興。

definition: certainly/also written 一準|一准[yi1 zhun3]
I/me/my/(often used in early vernacular literature)
to act as surety for sb/to be sb's guarantor/to stand bail for sb
my husband and master (archaic)/playboy of rich family/pimp
to show understanding/to excuse/to presume/to expect
son-in-law (used by wife's family)/uncle (husband of father's sister)
